communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of the following records in the possession, custody, or control of the Moab Police Department related to the software platform commonly known as Fog Reveal, including any contracts or records referencing Fog Data Science or its products.


1. Usage, access, and audit records

Records sufficient to show:
	•	The total number of searches or queries conducted using Fog Reveal
	•	The number of searches by month and year
	•	The number of user accounts and the number of active users
	•	Audit logs, audit reports, access reviews, or other records reflecting user activity
	•	The divisions, units, or personnel authorized to access the system

If individual user names are classified as protected, I am requesting records showing activity by unique identifier, unit, or in aggregate form.

If raw logs are exempt, please provide aggregate statistical reports or any records sufficient to show these totals.


2. Policies and procedures

All policies, standard operating procedures, memoranda, or guidelines governing:
	•	Authorized use of Fog Reveal
	•	Legal process or approval requirements prior to conducting a search
	•	Supervisory review or auditing of use
	•	Retention of search history or query results
	•	Training or certification required for access


3. Training and user materials

All user manuals, training materials, presentations, quick-reference guides, onboarding documents, and vendor-provided materials in the department’s possession.


4. Contracts and procurement records
	•	Contracts, purchase orders, amendments, and statements of work
	•	Licensing agreements or terms of service
	•	Invoices and records sufficient to show the total amount paid
	•	Any agreements with Fog Data Science or resellers or intermediaries


5. Communications

All communications, including emails, memoranda, and presentations, that:
	•	Discuss acquisition, evaluation, or deployment of Fog Reveal
	•	Describe system capabilities or data sources
	•	Refer to audits, oversight, compliance, or concerns about use
	•	Compare Fog Reveal with other investigative tools

Search terms should include: “Fog Reveal,” “Fog Data Science,” and “Fog.”


Format and processing

I request that responsive records be provided in electronic format where available.

I am willing to accept rolling production of records as they are located and reviewed.

If any portion of this request is denied, please:
	•	Cite the specific statutory basis for the denial under GRAMA, and
	•	Release all reasonably segregable non-exempt material.

If you believe this request is overly broad, I am happy to discuss reasonable narrowing.

Fee waiver

This request is made for news gathering and not for commercial purposes. Disclosure of the requested records is in the public interest. I request a waiver of any fees.


Please confirm receipt of this request and provide the timeline for your response as required by Utah Code § 63G-2-204.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of the following records in the possession, custody, or control of the California Highway Patrol related to the Cobwebs Technologies platform, including any product or system referred to as “Cobwebs” or “Tangles.”


1. Usage, access, and audit records

Records sufficient to show:
	•	The total number of searches or queries conducted in the system
	•	The number of searches by month and year
	•	The number of user accounts and the number of active users
	•	Audit logs, audit reports, access reviews, or other records reflecting user activity in the system
	•	The CHP divisions, units, offices, or task forces with access to the system

To the extent individual user identities are exempt, I am seeking records showing activity by unique identifier, unit, or in aggregate form.

If raw audit logs are exempt, please provide aggregate statistical reports or any records sufficient to show these totals.


2. Policies and procedures

All policies, standard operating procedures, guidelines, memoranda, or directives governing:
	•	Authorized use of the system
	•	Approval requirements or permissible purposes
	•	Supervisory review or auditing of use
	•	Retention of search records or user activity
	•	Training or certification required for access


3. Training and user materials

All user manuals, training materials, presentations, quick-reference guides, onboarding documents, or other instructional material provided to CHP personnel, including vendor-provided materials in CHP’s possession.


4. Contracts and procurement records
	•	Contracts, purchase orders, amendments, and statements of work
	•	Licensing agreements or terms of service
	•	Invoices and records sufficient to show amounts paid
	•	Any data-sharing or access agreements with Cobwebs Technologies or any intermediary reseller


5. Communications

All communications, including emails, memoranda, and presentations, that:
	•	Discuss acquisition or deployment of the system. Search terms should include: “Cobwebs,” “Cobwebs Technologies,” and “Tangles.”

I request that responsive records be provided in electronic format where available.

I am willing to accept rolling production of records as they are located and reviewed.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the specific statutory exemption relied upon and release all reasonably segregable non-exempt material.

If you believe this request is unduly burdensome, I am happy to discuss reasonable ways to narrow it

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra
